trans-unit.source: Deploy WebJobs using Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Deploy WebJobs using Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Learn how to deploy Azure WebJobs to Azure App Service Web Apps using Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to deploy Azure WebJobs to Azure App Service Web Apps using Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Deploy WebJobs using Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Deploy WebJobs using Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This topic explains how to use Visual Studio to deploy a Console Application project to a web app in <link><linkText>App Service</linkText><title></title></link> as an <link><linkText>Azure WebJob</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This topic explains how to use Visual Studio to deploy a Console Application project to a web app in <link><linkText>App Service</linkText><title></title></link> as an <link><linkText>Azure WebJob</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For information about how to deploy WebJobs by using the <link><linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title></link>, see <link><linkText>Run Background tasks with WebJobs</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about how to deploy WebJobs by using the <link><linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title></link>, see <link><linkText>Run Background tasks with WebJobs</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: When Visual Studio deploys a WebJobs-enabled Console Application project, it performs two tasks:
trans-unit.target: When Visual Studio deploys a WebJobs-enabled Console Application project, it performs two tasks:

trans-unit.source: Copies runtime files to the appropriate folder in the web app (App_Data/jobs/continuous for continuous WebJobs, App_Data/jobs/triggered for scheduled and on-demand WebJobs).
trans-unit.target: Copies runtime files to the appropriate folder in the web app (App_Data/jobs/continuous for continuous WebJobs, App_Data/jobs/triggered for scheduled and on-demand WebJobs).

trans-unit.source: Sets up <link><linkText>Azure Scheduler jobs</linkText><title></title></link> for WebJobs that are scheduled to run at particular times.
trans-unit.target: Sets up <link><linkText>Azure Scheduler jobs</linkText><title></title></link> for WebJobs that are scheduled to run at particular times.

trans-unit.source: (This is not needed for continuous WebJobs.)
trans-unit.target: (This is not needed for continuous WebJobs.)

trans-unit.source: A WebJobs-enabled project has the following items added to it:
trans-unit.target: A WebJobs-enabled project has the following items added to it:

trans-unit.source: The <link><linkText>Microsoft.Web.WebJobs.Publish</linkText><title></title></link> NuGet package.
trans-unit.target: The <link><linkText>Microsoft.Web.WebJobs.Publish</linkText><title></title></link> NuGet package.

trans-unit.source: A <link><linkText>webjob-publish-settings.json</linkText><title></title></link> file that contains deployment and scheduler settings.
trans-unit.target: A <link><linkText>webjob-publish-settings.json</linkText><title></title></link> file that contains deployment and scheduler settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Diagram showing what is added to a Console App to enable deployment as a WebJob</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Diagram showing what is added to a Console App to enable deployment as a WebJob</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can add these items to an existing Console Application project or use a template to create a new WebJobs-enabled Console Application project.
trans-unit.target: You can add these items to an existing Console Application project or use a template to create a new WebJobs-enabled Console Application project.

trans-unit.source: You can deploy a project as a WebJob by itself, or link it to a web project so that it automatically deploys whenever you deploy the web project.
trans-unit.target: You can deploy a project as a WebJob by itself, or link it to a web project so that it automatically deploys whenever you deploy the web project.

trans-unit.source: To link projects, Visual Studio includes the name of the WebJobs-enabled project in a <link><linkText>webjobs-list.json</linkText><title></title></link> file in the web project.
trans-unit.target: To link projects, Visual Studio includes the name of the WebJobs-enabled project in a <link><linkText>webjobs-list.json</linkText><title></title></link> file in the web project.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Diagram showing WebJob project linking to web project</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Diagram showing WebJob project linking to web project</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: WebJobs deployment features are available in Visual Studio 2013 when you install Azure SDK version 2.4 or later versions:
trans-unit.target: WebJobs deployment features are available in Visual Studio 2013 when you install Azure SDK version 2.4 or later versions:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Azure SDK for Visual Studio 2013</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Azure SDK for Visual Studio 2013</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The WebJobs deployment features are also included in <link><linkText>Visual Studio 2013 Update 3</linkText><title></title></link> and later updates.
trans-unit.target: The WebJobs deployment features are also included in <link><linkText>Visual Studio 2013 Update 3</linkText><title></title></link> and later updates.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Enable WebJobs deployment for an existing Console Application project
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Enable WebJobs deployment for an existing Console Application project

trans-unit.source: You have two options:
trans-unit.target: You have two options:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Enable automatic deployment with a web project</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Enable automatic deployment with a web project</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Configure an existing Console Application project so that it automatically deploys as a WebJob when you deploy a web project.
trans-unit.target: Configure an existing Console Application project so that it automatically deploys as a WebJob when you deploy a web project.

trans-unit.source: Use this option when you want to run your WebJob in the same web app in which you run the related web application.
trans-unit.target: Use this option when you want to run your WebJob in the same web app in which you run the related web application.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Enable deployment without a web project</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Enable deployment without a web project</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Configure an existing Console Application project to deploy as a WebJob by itself, with no link to a web project.
trans-unit.target: Configure an existing Console Application project to deploy as a WebJob by itself, with no link to a web project.

trans-unit.source: Use this option when you want to run a WebJob in a web app by itself, with no web application running in the web app.
trans-unit.target: Use this option when you want to run a WebJob in a web app by itself, with no web application running in the web app.

trans-unit.source: You might want to do this in order to be able to scale your WebJob resources independently of your web application resources.
trans-unit.target: You might want to do this in order to be able to scale your WebJob resources independently of your web application resources.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Enable automatic WebJobs deployment with a web project
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Enable automatic WebJobs deployment with a web project

trans-unit.source: Right-click the web project in Solution Explorer, and then click Add > Existing Project as Azure WebJob.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the web project in Solution Explorer, and then click Add > Existing Project as Azure WebJob.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Existing Project as Azure WebJob</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Existing Project as Azure WebJob</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The <link><linkText>Add Azure WebJob</linkText><title></title></link> dialog box appears.
trans-unit.target: The <link><linkText>Add Azure WebJob</linkText><title></title></link> dialog box appears.

trans-unit.source: In the Project name drop-down list, select the Console Application project to add as a WebJob.
trans-unit.target: In the Project name drop-down list, select the Console Application project to add as a WebJob.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Selecting project in Add Azure WebJob dialog</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Selecting project in Add Azure WebJob dialog</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Complete the Add Azure WebJob dialog, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: Complete the Add Azure WebJob dialog, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Enable WebJobs deployment without a web project
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Enable WebJobs deployment without a web project

trans-unit.source: Right-click the Console Application project in Solution Explorer, and then click Publish as Azure WebJob.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the Console Application project in Solution Explorer, and then click Publish as Azure WebJob.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Publish as Azure WebJob</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Publish as Azure WebJob</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The Add Azure WebJob dialog box appears, with the project selected in the Project name box.
trans-unit.target: The Add Azure WebJob dialog box appears, with the project selected in the Project name box.

trans-unit.source: Complete the Add Azure WebJob dialog box, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: Complete the Add Azure WebJob dialog box, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: The Publish Web wizard appears.
trans-unit.target: The Publish Web wizard appears.

trans-unit.source: If you don't want to publish immediately, close the wizard.
trans-unit.target: If you don't want to publish immediately, close the wizard.

trans-unit.source: The settings that you've entered are saved for when you do want to <link><linkText>deploy the project</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The settings that you've entered are saved for when you do want to <link><linkText>deploy the project</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Create a new WebJobs-enabled project
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Create a new WebJobs-enabled project

trans-unit.source: To create a new WebJobs-enabled project, you can use the Console Application project template and enable WebJobs deployment as explained in <link><linkText>the previous section</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To create a new WebJobs-enabled project, you can use the Console Application project template and enable WebJobs deployment as explained in <link><linkText>the previous section</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: As an alternative, you can use the WebJobs new-project template:
trans-unit.target: As an alternative, you can use the WebJobs new-project template:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Use the WebJobs new-project template for an independent WebJob</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Use the WebJobs new-project template for an independent WebJob</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Create a project and configure it to deploy by itself as a WebJob, with no link to a web project.
trans-unit.target: Create a project and configure it to deploy by itself as a WebJob, with no link to a web project.

trans-unit.source: Use this option when you want to run a WebJob in a web app by itself, with no web application running in the web app.
trans-unit.target: Use this option when you want to run a WebJob in a web app by itself, with no web application running in the web app.

trans-unit.source: You might want to do this in order to be able to scale your WebJob resources independently of your web application resources.
trans-unit.target: You might want to do this in order to be able to scale your WebJob resources independently of your web application resources.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Use the WebJobs new-project template for a WebJob linked to a web project</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Use the WebJobs new-project template for a WebJob linked to a web project</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Create a project that is configured to deploy automatically as a WebJob when a web project in the same solution is deployed.
trans-unit.target: Create a project that is configured to deploy automatically as a WebJob when a web project in the same solution is deployed.

trans-unit.source: Use this option when you want to run your WebJob in the same web app in which you run the related web application.
trans-unit.target: Use this option when you want to run your WebJob in the same web app in which you run the related web application.

trans-unit.source: In the SDK 2.4 release, the WebJobs new-project template isn't much easier than creating a Console Application project and enabling WebJobs deployment.
trans-unit.target: In the SDK 2.4 release, the WebJobs new-project template isn't much easier than creating a Console Application project and enabling WebJobs deployment.

trans-unit.source: In the future, the WebJobs new-project template will be more convenient for <link><linkText>WebJobs SDK</linkText><title></title></link> development, because it will automatically install the appropriate WebJobs SDK NuGet packages.
trans-unit.target: In the future, the WebJobs new-project template will be more convenient for <link><linkText>WebJobs SDK</linkText><title></title></link> development, because it will automatically install the appropriate WebJobs SDK NuGet packages.

trans-unit.source: Until then, you can configure a project to use the WebJobs SDK by installing the packages manually as shown in the <link><linkText>WebJobs SDK tutorial</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Until then, you can configure a project to use the WebJobs SDK by installing the packages manually as shown in the <link><linkText>WebJobs SDK tutorial</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Use the WebJobs new-project template for an independent WebJob
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Use the WebJobs new-project template for an independent WebJob

trans-unit.source: Click File > New Project, and then in the New Project dialog box click Cloud > Microsoft Azure WebJob.
trans-unit.target: Click File > New Project, and then in the New Project dialog box click Cloud > Microsoft Azure WebJob.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Project dialog showing WebJob template</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Project dialog showing WebJob template</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Follow the directions shown earlier to <link><linkText>make the Console Application project an independent WebJobs project</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Follow the directions shown earlier to <link><linkText>make the Console Application project an independent WebJobs project</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Use the WebJobs new-project template for a WebJob linked to a web project
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Use the WebJobs new-project template for a WebJob linked to a web project

trans-unit.source: Right-click the web project in Solution Explorer, and then click Add > New Azure WebJob Project.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the web project in Solution Explorer, and then click Add > New Azure WebJob Project.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Azure WebJob Project menu entry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Azure WebJob Project menu entry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The <link><linkText>Add Azure WebJob</linkText><title></title></link> dialog box appears.
trans-unit.target: The <link><linkText>Add Azure WebJob</linkText><title></title></link> dialog box appears.

trans-unit.source: Complete the Add Azure WebJob dialog box, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: Complete the Add Azure WebJob dialog box, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>The Add Azure WebJob dialog
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>The Add Azure WebJob dialog

trans-unit.source: The Add Azure WebJob dialog enables you to enter WebJob name and scheduling settings for your WebJob.
trans-unit.target: The Add Azure WebJob dialog enables you to enter WebJob name and scheduling settings for your WebJob.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add Azure WebJob dialog</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add Azure WebJob dialog</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The fields in this dialog correspond to fields on the New Job dialog of the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: The fields in this dialog correspond to fields on the New Job dialog of the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Run Background tasks with WebJobs</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Run Background tasks with WebJobs</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For a scheduled WebJob (not for continuous WebJobs), Visual Studio creates an <link><linkText>Azure Scheduler</linkText><title></title></link> job collection if one doesn't exist yet, and it creates a job in the collection:
trans-unit.target: For a scheduled WebJob (not for continuous WebJobs), Visual Studio creates an <link><linkText>Azure Scheduler</linkText><title></title></link> job collection if one doesn't exist yet, and it creates a job in the collection:

trans-unit.source: The scheduler job collection is named WebJobs-{regionname} where {regionname} refers to the region the web app is hosted in.
trans-unit.target: The scheduler job collection is named WebJobs-{regionname} where {regionname} refers to the region the web app is hosted in.

trans-unit.source: For example: WebJobs-WestUS.
trans-unit.target: For example: WebJobs-WestUS.

trans-unit.source: The scheduler job is named {webappname}-{webjobname}.
trans-unit.target: The scheduler job is named {webappname}-{webjobname}.

trans-unit.source: For example: MyWebApp-MyWebJob.
trans-unit.target: For example: MyWebApp-MyWebJob.

trans-unit.source: * For information about command-line deployment, see <link><linkText>Enabling Command-line or Continuous Delivery of Azure WebJobs</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: * For information about command-line deployment, see <link><linkText>Enabling Command-line or Continuous Delivery of Azure WebJobs</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: * If you configure a Recurring Job and set recurrence frequency to a number of minutes, the Azure Scheduler service is not free.
trans-unit.target: * If you configure a Recurring Job and set recurrence frequency to a number of minutes, the Azure Scheduler service is not free.

trans-unit.source: Other frequencies (hours, days, and so forth) are free.
trans-unit.target: Other frequencies (hours, days, and so forth) are free.

trans-unit.source: * If you deploy a WebJob and then decide you want to change the type of WebJob and redeploy, you'll need to delete the webjobs-publish-settings.json file.
trans-unit.target: * If you deploy a WebJob and then decide you want to change the type of WebJob and redeploy, you'll need to delete the webjobs-publish-settings.json file.

trans-unit.source: This will make Visual Studio show the publishing options again, so you can change the type of WebJob.
trans-unit.target: This will make Visual Studio show the publishing options again, so you can change the type of WebJob.

trans-unit.source: * If you deploy a WebJob and later change the run mode from continuous to non-continuous or vice versa, Visual Studio creates a new WebJob in Azure when you redeploy.
trans-unit.target: * If you deploy a WebJob and later change the run mode from continuous to non-continuous or vice versa, Visual Studio creates a new WebJob in Azure when you redeploy.

trans-unit.source: If you change other scheduling settings but leave run mode the same or switch between Scheduled and On Demand, Visual Studio updates the existing job rather than create a new one.
trans-unit.target: If you change other scheduling settings but leave run mode the same or switch between Scheduled and On Demand, Visual Studio updates the existing job rather than create a new one.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>webjob-publish-settings.json
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>webjob-publish-settings.json

trans-unit.source: When you configure a Console Application for WebJobs deployment, Visual Studio installs the <link><linkText>Microsoft.Web.WebJobs.Publish</linkText><title></title></link> NuGet package
trans-unit.target: When you configure a Console Application for WebJobs deployment, Visual Studio installs the <link><linkText>Microsoft.Web.WebJobs.Publish</linkText><title></title></link> NuGet package

trans-unit.source: and stores scheduling information in a webjob-publish-settings.json file in the project Properties folder of the WebJobs project.
trans-unit.target: and stores scheduling information in a webjob-publish-settings.json file in the project Properties folder of the WebJobs project.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example of that file:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example of that file:

trans-unit.source: You can edit this file directly, and Visual Studio provides IntelliSense.
trans-unit.target: You can edit this file directly, and Visual Studio provides IntelliSense.

trans-unit.source: The file schema is stored at <link><linkText>http://schemastore.org</linkText><title></title></link> and can be viewed there.
trans-unit.target: The file schema is stored at <link><linkText>http://schemastore.org</linkText><title></title></link> and can be viewed there.

trans-unit.source: * If you configure a Recurring Job and set recurrence frequency to a number of minutes, the Azure Scheduler service is not free.
trans-unit.target: * If you configure a Recurring Job and set recurrence frequency to a number of minutes, the Azure Scheduler service is not free.

trans-unit.source: Other frequencies (hours, days, and so forth) are free.
trans-unit.target: Other frequencies (hours, days, and so forth) are free.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>webjobs-list.json
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>webjobs-list.json

trans-unit.source: When you link a WebJobs-enabled project to a web project, Visual Studio stores the name of the WebJobs project in a webjobs-list.json file in the web project's Properties folder.
trans-unit.target: When you link a WebJobs-enabled project to a web project, Visual Studio stores the name of the WebJobs project in a webjobs-list.json file in the web project's Properties folder.

trans-unit.source: The list may contain multiple WebJobs projects, as shown in the following example:
trans-unit.target: The list may contain multiple WebJobs projects, as shown in the following example:

trans-unit.source: You can edit this file directly, and Visual Studio provides IntelliSense.
trans-unit.target: You can edit this file directly, and Visual Studio provides IntelliSense.

trans-unit.source: The file schema is stored at <link><linkText>http://schemastore.org</linkText><title></title></link> and can be viewed there.
trans-unit.target: The file schema is stored at <link><linkText>http://schemastore.org</linkText><title></title></link> and can be viewed there.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Deploy a WebJobs project
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Deploy a WebJobs project

trans-unit.source: A WebJobs project that you have linked to a web project deploys automatically with the web project.
trans-unit.target: A WebJobs project that you have linked to a web project deploys automatically with the web project.

trans-unit.source: For information about web project deployment, see <link><linkText>How to deploy to Web Apps</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about web project deployment, see <link><linkText>How to deploy to Web Apps</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To deploy a WebJobs project by itself, right-click the project in Solution Explorer, and click Publish as Azure WebJob.
trans-unit.target: To deploy a WebJobs project by itself, right-click the project in Solution Explorer, and click Publish as Azure WebJob.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Publish as Azure WebJob</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Publish as Azure WebJob</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For an independent WebJob, the same Publish Web wizard that is used for web projects appears, but with fewer settings available to change.
trans-unit.target: For an independent WebJob, the same Publish Web wizard that is used for web projects appears, but with fewer settings available to change.

trans-unit.source: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to <link><linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title></link>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to <link><linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title></link>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Next Steps
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Next Steps

trans-unit.source: This article has explained how to deploy WebJobs by using Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: This article has explained how to deploy WebJobs by using Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: For information about how to deploy Azure WebJobs from Visual Studio and by using a continuous delivery process, see <link><linkText>Azure WebJobs - Recommended Resources - Deployment</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about how to deploy Azure WebJobs from Visual Studio and by using a continuous delivery process, see <link><linkText>Azure WebJobs - Recommended Resources - Deployment</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: What's changed
trans-unit.target: What's changed

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: <link><linkText>Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: <link><linkText>Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change of the Azure portal to the Azure preview portal see: <link><linkText>Reference for navigating the preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change of the Azure portal to the Azure preview portal see: <link><linkText>Reference for navigating the preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
